text: mass percentage is simply another way of
finding the concentration of the
solution mass percentage is equal to
mass of some compound x / the total mass
of the solution times 100 the 100 gives
you the percentage this is a fraction so
you divide mass by mass so the units
cancel out so mass percent is unitless
now let's do a problem with mass
percentage
the question tells us that we have 49 g
of gold 25 G of carbon and .5 kg of
water we need to find the mass percent
of carbon water and gold in our solution
the first step is to find the mass
percentage of gold to find the mass
percentage of gold we simply use the
formula so 49 g of gold divided by the
total mass of the solution 4 9 G plus 25
G plus now we can't add kilog to G so
the first step is to convert this to G
we get plus 500
G now we multiply the whole thing by 100
to find the percentage and we get
88.5% so the mass percent of gold is
8.5 to find the mass perent of carbon we
follow the same exact formula 25 G of
carbon divided by the total G of the
solution multiplied by 100 gives us 4.4
uh% so the mass percent of carbon is 4.4
the last step could be done in two ways
one way you simply use the formula you
plug things in you find the result a
quicker way would be simply to realize
that if you add these guys up and
subtract it from 100 we get the mass
percent of the final thing final
compound within our solution mainly
water so
100us 8.5 + 4.5 gives you
87.1% so the mass percent of water
within our solution is 80 is
